intro: Zappania, commonly known as the "false dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to various regions of Africa and the Mediterranean. The plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and showy, yellow or orange composite flowers. Zappania species typically grow in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to arid environments. They are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive foliage and flowers.
